With temperatures soaring up to 45º C easily, even the best of ACs, the coolest of drinks and the best of programmes can become dampening. But for those who (Read More)know the chill hills can give you, for those who value change over a lot of other things, for those who love to explore what nature has on offer for us, summer is just another season that can be cheated or for that matter, can be enjoyed. This summer, beat the heat and find your joy in one of these exotic places to visit near Delhi. Here is the list of 25 Places To Visit Near Delhi During Summer 1. Manali 4.8 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Solang Valley Hadimba Devi Temple Manali Mall Road Manali, with its cool alpine climate, offers a refreshing escape from Delhi's scorching summer heat. Nestled amidst the snow-capped peaks of the Himalayas, it provides a plethora of adventure activities and serene landscapes, making it an ideal summer getaway. Furthermore, the lush greenery, cascading waterfalls, and the Beas River's gentle flow add to its charm, drawing tourists from Delhi and beyond. Distance from Delhi: 542 km Best Time: October to June 53 Manali Attractions View Packages Read More 2. Auli 4.3 /5 View 12+ photos Known For : Auli Ropeway Skiing in Auli Joshimath Auli, set amidst the Garhwal Himalayas, offers a perfect respite from Delhi's blazing summer temperatures. Renowned for its panoramic meadows, ski slopes, and breathtaking views of the snow-clad peaks, Auli is a paradise for nature lovers. Its pristine environment and opportunities for trekking and cable car rides make it an irresistible summer retreat for those seeking adventure and tranquility. Distance from Delhi: 493 km Best Time: December - February 12 Auli Attractions View Packages Read More 3. Shimla 4.8 /5 View 24+ photos Known For : Jakhu Temple Mall Road, Shimla Rashtrapati Niwas (Viceregal Lodge) Shimla, the erstwhile summer capital of British India, provides a cool and pleasant escape from Delhi's scorching summer heat. Its colonial-era architecture, winding streets, and the bustling Mall Road offer a blend of nostalgia and modernity. With verdant hills, apple orchards, and captivating views of the Himalayas, Shimla has remained a perennial favorite for those seeking a refreshing summer getaway. Distance from Delhi: 349 km Best Time: October to June 65 Shimla Attractions View Packages Read More 4. Rishikesh 4.5 /5 View 37+ photos Known For : Triveni Ghat Rafting in Rishikesh Lakshman Jhula Rishikesh, nestled at the foothills of the Himalayas, offers a serene respite from the sweltering heat of Delhi with its cool river breezes and dense green surroundings. Revered as the "Yoga Capital of the World", visitors are drawn to its tranquil ashrams, spiritual aura, and thrilling adventure sports on the Ganges, like white-water rafting. The evening Ganga Aarti at the ghats, against the backdrop of the setting sun, further amplifies the spiritual and rejuvenating experience of the town. Mussoorie 4.8 /5 View 31+ photos Known For : Mussoorie Mall Road Lal Tibba Kempty Falls Mussoorie, often referred to as the 'Queen of the Hills,' presents a refreshing escape from Delhi's scorching summer with its cool and temperate climate. The hill station boasts picturesque landscapes with cascading waterfalls, lush green valleys, and panoramic views of the snow-clad Himalayan ranges. The charming colonial architecture, bustling Mall Road, and serene spots like Kempty Falls and Gun Hill make it an ideal summer retreat for those seeking both relaxation and adventure. Distance from Delhi: 271 km Best Time: September to June 36 Mussoorie Attractions View Packages Read More 6. Kalsi Kalsi, tucked away in the Dehradun district of Uttarakhand, is a tranquil retreat from the summer heat of Delhi due to its pleasant climate and abundant greenery. Famous for the Ashoka Rock Edict, an ancient inscription by Emperor Ashoka, Kalsi is a blend of historical significance and natural beauty. Its proximity to the confluence of the Yamuna and Tons rivers and surrounding mountainous landscape makes it a perfect destination for those seeking serenity and a touch of history.Best Time: March to May Distance from Delhi: 272 km Read More 7. Nainital 4.4 /5 View 36+ photos Known For : Naini Lake Snow View Point Mall Road Nainital Nainital, nestled in the Kumaon foothills of the outer Himalayas, offers a cool and refreshing escape from the scorching summer temperatures of Delhi. The town's emerald-colored Naini Lake, encircled by lush hills, provides not only a picturesque setting but also opportunities for boating and leisurely walks. With its colonial-era charm, vibrant local markets, and a plethora of sightseeing options, Nainital serves as an ideal summer getaway for both relaxation and adventure. Distance from Delhi: 285 km Best Time: Throughout the year 33 Nainital Attractions View Packages Read More 8. Kufri 4.0 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Himalayan Nature Park (Kufri Zoo) Skiing in Kufri Mahasu Peak Kufri, situated amidst the picturesque Himalayas, offers a cool respite from Delhi's summer heat with its invigorating mountain air and lush greenery. The hill station is renowned for its panoramic views, thrilling trekking paths, and the popular Kufri Fun World, which boasts attractions like the mini-zoo and the Mahasu Peak trek. Moreover, its proximity to Shimla ensures that visitors can enjoy a combined experience of two renowned destinations in one trip. Distance from Delhi: 363 km Best Time: November to March 12 Kufri Attractions View Packages Read More 9. Kasauli 4.2 /5 View 22+ photos Known For : Monkey Point Toy Train Ride Timber Trail Kasauli, with its colonial-era charm and misty mountain backdrop, provides an idyllic escape from the scorching heat of Delhi's summer. The serene hill station, lined with cobbled roads and lush greenery, offers peaceful walks like the Gilbert Trail, where travelers can immerse themselves in nature. Its elevated position ensures pleasant temperatures, making it perfect for those looking to unwind amidst cool breezes and captivating views. Distance from Delhi: 295 km Best Time: March - June; September - November 13 Kasauli Attractions View Packages Read More 10. Almora 4.3 /5 View 20+ photos Known For : Jageshwar Dunagiri Kasar Devi Temple Almora, nestled in the lap of the Kumaon hills, offers a refreshing retreat from Delhi's sweltering summer with its cool and pleasant climate. Renowned for its panoramic views of the Himalayas, rich cultural heritage, and vibrant local markets, it serves as a serene haven for nature lovers and culture enthusiasts alike. The town's tranquility combined with its scenic beauty makes it an ideal summer destination for relaxation and rejuvenation. Distance from Delhi: 349 km Best Time: Throughout the year 16 Almora Attractions View Packages Read More 11. Lansdowne 4.6 /5 View 17+ photos Known For : Bhulla Lake Tip N Top Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple Lansdowne, with its pristine beauty and colonial charm, provides a perfect respite from Delhi's scorching summer heat. Set amidst the Garhwal hills, this tranquil hill station boasts of untouched forests, panoramic views, and a serene ambiance, making it an ideal escape for nature enthusiasts. The town's colonial-era churches, tranquil lakes, and nature walks further enhance its appeal as a refreshing summer getaway. Distance from Delhi: 243 km Best Time: Throughout the year 14 Lansdowne Attractions View Packages Read More 12. Bhimtal 4.2 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Bhimtal Lake Aquarium Island Cafe Hanuman Garhi Bhimtal, nestled in the Kumaon region, is a delightful hill station renowned for its picturesque lake and cool, invigorating climate during the summer months. Just a short drive from Delhi, it offers travelers an enchanting retreat away from the urban hustle, with activities like boating, nature walks, and bird watching. The serene ambiance, combined with its scenic beauty, makes Bhimtal a preferred summer escape for those seeking solace and relaxation. Distance from Delhi: 292 km Best Time: March to June, September to December 11 Bhimtal Attractions View Packages Read More 13. Dharamshala 4.3 /5 View 31+ photos Known For : Dalai Lama Temple St. John in the Wilderness Church Dharamshala Cricket Stadium Dharamshala, with its sublime backdrop of the Dhauladhar Range, offers a refreshing mountainous escape from the scorching summer heat of the plains. Renowned as the residence of the Dalai Lama, the town intertwines Tibetan culture with colonial charm, attracting visitors to its monasteries, cafes, and treks. The combination of spiritual ambiance, cool climate, and breathtaking vistas makes Dharamshala a top summer destination for Delhiites. Distance from Delhi: 481 km Best Time: October to June 40 Dharamsala Attractions View Packages Read More 14. Dehradun 4.3 /5 View 34+ photos Known For : Robber's Cave Mindrolling Monastery Tapkeshwar Temple Dehradun, nestled in the Doon Valley, presents a serene escape from Delhi's summer heat with its pleasant temperatures and lush green landscapes. As the gateway to popular hill stations like Mussoorie, it boasts attractions such as the Robber's Cave, Tapkeshwar Temple, and abundant natural springs. Its combination of colonial architecture, bustling bazaars, and proximity to the Himalayas makes Dehradun an ideal summer retreat for those seeking both relaxation and adventure. Distance from Delhi: 239 km Best Time: Throughout the year 38 Dehradun Attractions View Packages Read More 15. Ranikhet 4.3 /5 View 19+ photos Known For : Chaubatia Orchards Majhkhali Golf Course Ranikhet, with its cool climate and verdant pine forests, offers a refreshing contrast to Delhi's scorching summer heat. Perched in the Kumaon hills of Uttarakhand, this hill station provides breathtaking views of the snow-clad Himalayan peaks, notably the majestic Nanda Devi. Its colonial-era charm, combined with attractions like the Chaubatia Gardens and Jhula Devi Temple, make Ranikhet a perfect summer escape for nature lovers and tranquility seekers. Distance from Delhi: 341 km Best Time: Throughout the year 22 Ranikhet Attractions View Packages Read More 16. Naukuchiatal 4.5 /5 View 7+ photos Known For : Lake Naukuchiatal Boating, Naukuchiatal Bhimtal Lake Naukuchiatal, known for its picturesque nine-cornered lake, offers a serene respite from Delhi's sweltering summer temperatures. Nestled in the hills of Uttarakhand, this destination is not only about lakeside leisure but also presents ample opportunities for boating, fishing, and bird-watching. The tranquil surroundings, combined with the gentle climate, make Naukuchiatal a rejuvenating summer haven for tourists. Distance from Delhi: 292 km Best Time: April to June, September to November 10 Naukuchiatal Attractions Read More 17. Arki 4.7 /5 View 12+ photos Known For : Arki Fort Diwan-i-Khaas Arki Palace Arki, a hidden gem in Himachal Pradesh, boasts of its cool climate and historic architecture, making it a perfect escape from Delhi's scorching summers. Renowned for its well-preserved fort and intricate frescoes, visitors are treated to a blend of history and scenic beauty. The tranquil town, with its winding roads, lush green landscapes, and rich heritage, provides a refreshing break from urban bustle. Distance from Delhi: 330 km Best Time: Throughout the year 9 Arki Attractions Read More 18. Neemrana 4.8 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Neemrana Fort Palace Zip Lining Baori Neemrana, located just a few hours from Delhi, offers a blend of history and luxury, making it a sought-after summer retreat. The town's centerpiece, the Neemrana Fort Palace, provides a majestic stay experience, allowing visitors to relive the regal past while enjoying modern amenities. Its proximity to Delhi, combined with its historical charm and cooling pools, makes Neemrana an ideal quick escape from the summer heat of the capital.Distance from Delhi: 120 km Distance from Delhi: 121 km Best Time: July to March 6 Neemrana Attractions Read More 19. Parwanoo 4.2 /5 View 6+ photos Known For : Timber Trail Cable car Ride Fruit orchards Parwanoo is a picturesque hill station that offers a refreshing respite from the scorching summer heat of the plains. Nestled in the Shivalik Range, it is famed for its sprawling orchards, lush greenery, and captivating mountain views, ensuring a serene environment for relaxation. Its easy accessibility from Delhi, combined with attractions like the Timber Trail and various orchard resorts, makes Parwanoo a preferred summer getaway for Delhiites.Distance from Delhi: 265 km Distance from Delhi: 267 km Best Time: March to May, October to November 10 Parwanoo Attractions Read More 20. Manesar 3.5 /5 View 8+ photos Manesar, with its proximity to Delhi, serves as a quick escape from the bustling city life into a more serene and green environment. The town boasts of luxurious resorts, some set amidst vast stretches of mango orchards, offering a refreshing ambiance for relaxation and rejuvenation. Furthermore, the Heritage Transport Museum and the leisurely walks through local villages provide unique experiences, making Manesar a delightful summer retreat.Distance from Delhi: 45 km Distance from Delhi: 60 km Read More 21. Mukteshwar 4.7 /5 View 18+ photos Known For : Sitla Chauli ki Jaali Mukteshwar Dham Temple Mukteshwar, perched high in the Kumaon Hills of Uttarakhand, offers panoramic views of the majestic Himalayas, providing an instant relief from the scorching summer heat of the plains. This tranquil hill station, with its dense coniferous forests and lush orchards, provides an idyllic setting for those looking for peace and rejuvenation. The age-old Mukteshwar Temple and charming British-era architecture further enrich the visitor's experience, making it an ideal summer escape from Delhi.Distance from Delhi: 350 km Distance from Delhi: 339 km Best Time: October to June 12 Mukteshwar Attractions View Packages Read More 22. Morni Hills 4.0 /5 Morni, Haryana's only hill station, is a serene retreat with its cool climate, offering a refreshing contrast to Delhi's summer heat. Nestled among the Shivalik range, Morni's rolling hills, tranquil lakes, and diverse flora and fauna provide a picturesque backdrop for treks and nature walks. Its proximity to Delhi makes it a convenient weekend getaway for those seeking a respite from the bustling city life.Distance from Delhi: 260 km Distance from Delhi: 259 km Read More 23. Dalhousie 4.6 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Panchpula Dainkund Peak Beeji's Park Dalhousie, with its colonial charm and panoramic views of the Dhauladhar mountain range, is a perfect escape from Delhi's scorching summer heat. Its dense pine and deodar forests, refreshing climate, and quaint architecture transport visitors to a bygone era, offering a peaceful retreat. Being relatively close to Delhi, it's an ideal destination for those wishing to experience the magic of the Himalayan foothills without traveling too far.Distance from Delhi: 560 km Distance from Delhi: 566 km Best Time: Throughout the year 29 Dalhousie Attractions View Packages Read More 24. Mcleodganj 4.2 /5 View 19+ photos Known For : Naddi View Point St. John in the Wilderness Church Dalai Lama Temple Mcleodganj, often dubbed as "Little Lhasa" because of its vibrant Tibetan culture, offers a refreshing break from the sizzling summer of Delhi. Perched in the Dhauladhar mountains, this picturesque town provides a unique blend of Tibetan and Indian cultures, set against a backdrop of misty hills and tranquil monasteries. Its pleasant weather, captivating landscapes, and spiritual aura make it a top choice for a rejuvenating summer getaway.Distance from Delhi: 480 km Distance from Delhi: 485 km Best Time: October to June 42 Mcleodganj Attractions View Packages Read More 25. Spiti Valley 4.5 /5 View 54+ photos Known For : Key Monastery Chandratal Lake Pin Valley National Park Spiti, known as the "Middle Land" between India and Tibet, offers a surreal escape from Delhi's blistering summer heat with its cool climate and stark landscapes. This high-altitude desert valley is adorned with ancient monasteries, quaint villages, and mesmerizing lunar terrains that transport visitors to a world far removed from the hustle and bustle. The serene environment and panoramic views of the majestic Himalayas make Spiti an unparalleled summer destination.Distance from Delhi: 340 km Distance from Delhi: 684 km Best Time: Mid May to Mid Oct 40 Spiti Attractions View Packages Read More Ready to beat the heat yet?
